result.execSummary:
The defendant Erin B. Schoelzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up. 

SAFE and follow up. 

DNA sample. 

Probation review hearings. 

 probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin B. Schoelzel

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Processed Financial Request Form

3:01 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 21CF437, 21CF683, 21CF1406, 22CF559 and 22CF288

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Julianne Lennon.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
21CF437
COUNT 1: False Imprisonment, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.
21CF683
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
21CF1406
COUNT 1: Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 5: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
22CF288
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
22CF559
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping Felony >> DRI. 

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to:
21CF437
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 3: Battery, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
21CF683
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
21CF1406
COUNT 6: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
22CF559
COUNT 5: Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; SAFE and f/u; Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; DV surcharge; DNA sample and surcharge; CC; Probation Review Hearings; and on 21CF437 (count 3), I/S 60 days jail for rule violations and I/S 30 hours of community service for rule violations. 

COURT grants defense 30 days to submit stipulation for jail credit. 

PRH: 11/11/22  at 1:15 p.m.

ADJ: 3:26 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
